description: From Old French rechargier, from re- +â€Ž chargier.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Water that has percolated from the ground surface to an aquifer.
(countable) The process of charging (an electrical device) again.
examples: My phone has needed five recharges in the last month.

verbs.description: recharge (third-person singular simple present recharges, present participle recharging, simple past and past participle recharged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To charge an electric battery after its power has been consumed.
(intransitive) To invigorate and revitalize one's energy level by removing stressful agents for a period of time.
examples: My body is a little bit sore from all of the practicing and playing and training, and your mind gets a little tired of it, too. It's nice to be able to recharge and come back fresh for the remainder of the year.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To reload a gun with ammunition.
(transitive) To add or restore water to an aquifer.

examples: Customer was recharged for doing same brake work (in November) that had been done in September. QA teams believes[sic] this work was a rip-off.

entries.meaning: To charge or accuse in return.
